top_categories.workout_context: Waukon 100 rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Waukon 100 when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Waukon 100. Make this intensity feel like home.
At 100 miles, Waukon 100 punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Waukon 100’s iowa rolling, local event demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Waukon 100’s 5,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Racing Waukon 100 isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Every session at Waukon 100 intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
At 100 miles, Waukon 100 rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Waukon 100 — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Waukon 100 — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Tempo is the race-day intensity of Waukon 100. Harder than Z2, easier than threshold — the pace you’ll hold for hours on iowa rolling gravel.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Waukon 100’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Waukon 100 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on iowa rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: iowa rolling, local event, midwest gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and G Spot to prepare you for 100 miles of iowa rolling gravel in Waukon, Iowa.
